turns.speaker: SANFORD
turns.text: Dante, let me grab a Gatorade.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: If you grab a Gatorade, then everybody's going to grab one.

turns.speaker: SANFORD
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: So? So nobody's going to want to pay for these Gatorades.

turns.speaker: SANFORD
turns.text: What do you care? Hey, what smells like shoe polish?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I've got a responsibility here. I can't let everybody grab free drinks.

turns.speaker: SANFORD
turns.text: What responsibility? You're closing the fucking store to play hockey.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: All right. Jesus, you fuckers are pushy.

turns.speaker: SANFORD
turns.text: Hey man, I hear Caitlin's marrying an Asian drum major.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: You only brought one ball?!

turns.speaker: SANFORD
turns.text: I thought Redding had like three balls!

turns.speaker: SANFORD
turns.text: Shit!

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: We get... what... twelve minutes of game, and it's over? Fuck! Fuck! Fuck! Fuck!!  I'm not even supposed to be here today!

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: You're late.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: What the hell are you doing here? I thought you were playing hockey at one.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: The boss called. Arthur fell ill.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Why are the shutters closed?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Someone jammed gum in the locks.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Bunch of savages in this town.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: That's what I said.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Shit, if I'd known you were working, I would've come even later.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: What time do you have to stay till?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: He assured me that he'd be here by twelve.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: What smells like shoe polish?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Go open the sore.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Some guy just came in refusing to pay late fees. He said the store was closed for two hours yesterday.  I tore up his membership.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Shocking abuse of authority.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: I'm a firm believer in the philosophy of a ruling class, especially since I rule.  Is the Pelican flying?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Don't screw with it. It makes us look suspicious.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: I can't stand a voyeur. I'll be back.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Want something to drink? I'm buying.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: No, thanks.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Who was on your phone this morning at about two-thirty? I was trying to call for a half an hour.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: I wanted to use your car.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: You don't want to know.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: You called Caitlin again?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: She called me.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Did you tell Veronica?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: One fight a day with Veronica is about all I can stomach, thanks.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: What do you two fight about?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I guess it's not really fighting. She just wants me to leave here, go back to school, get some direction.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: I'll bet the most frequent topic of arguments is Caitlin Bree.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: You win.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: I'm going to offer you some advice, my friend: let the past be the past. Forget Caitlin Bree. You've been with Veronica for how long now?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Seven months.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Chick's nuts about you. How long did you date Caitlin?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Five years.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Chick only made you nuts. She cheated on you how many times?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Eight and a half.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Eight and a half?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Party at John K's-senior year. I get blitzed and pass out in his bedroom. Caitlin comes in and dives all over me.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: That's cheating?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: In the middle of it, she calls me Brad.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: She called you Brad?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: She called me Brad.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: That's not cheating. People say crazy shit during sex. One time, I called this girl "Mom."

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I hit the lights and she freaks. Turns out she thought I was Brad Michaelson.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: She was supposed to meet Brad Michaelson in a bedroom. She picked the wrong one. She had no idea I was even at the party.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Oh, my God.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Great story, isn't it?

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: That girl was vile to you.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Interesting postscript to that story: Do you know who wound up going with Brad Michaelson in the other dark bedroom?

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Your mother.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Allan Harris.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Chess team Allan Harris?!

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: The two moved to Idaho together after graduation. They raise sheep.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: That's frightening.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: It takes different strokes to move the world.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: In light of this lurid tale, I don't see how you could even romanticize your relationship with Caitlin-she broke your heart and inadvertently drove men to deviant lifestyles.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Because there was a lot of good in our relationship.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Oh yeah.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I'm serious. Aside from the cheating, we were a great couple.  That's what high school's all about-algebra, bad lunch, and infidelity.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: You think things would be any different now?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: They are. When she calls me now, she's a different person-she's frightened and vulnerable. She's about to finish college and enter the real world. That's got to be scary for anyone.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Oh shit, I've got to place an order.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I'm talking to myself here.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: No, no, I'm listening. She's leaving college, and...?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: ...and she's looking to me for support. And I think that this is leading our relationship to a new level.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: What about Veronica?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I think the arguments Veronica and I are having are some kind of manifestation of a subconscious desire to break away from her so that I can pursue the possibility of a more meaningful relationship with Caitlin.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Caitlin's on the same wave-length?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I think it's safe to say yes.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Then I think all four of you had better sit down and talk it over.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: All four?

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: You, Veronica, Caitlin...  ...and Caitlin's fiancé.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Do you know that article is accurate? Caitlin's really getting married!

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: You know what I just watched?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Me pulling a can off some moron's fist.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Return of the Jedi.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Didn't you hear me? Caitlin really is getting married.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Which did you like better: Jedi or The Empire Strikes Back.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Empire.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Blasphemy.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Empire had the better ending: Luke gets his hand cut off, and finds out Vader's his father; Han gets frozen and taken away by Boba Fett.  It ends on such a down note. And that's life-a series of down endings. All Jedi had was a bunch of Muppets.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: There was something else going on in Jedi. I never noticed it until today.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: All right, Vader's boss...

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: The Emperor.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Right, the Emperor. Now the Emperor is kind of a spiritual figure, yes?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: How do you mean?

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Well, he's like the pope for the dark side of the Force. He's a holy man; a shaman, kind of, albeit an evil one.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I guess.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Now, he's in charge of the Empire. The Imperial government is under his control. And the entire galaxy is under Imperial rule.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Then wouldn't that logically mean that it's a theocracy? If the head of the Empire is a priest of some sort, then it stands to reason that the government is therefore one based on religion.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: It would stand to reason, yes.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Hence, the Empire was a fascist theocracy, and the rebel forces were therefore battling religious persecution.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: More or less.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: The only problem is that at no point in the series did I ever hear Leia or any of the rebels declare a particular religious belief.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I think they were Catholics.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: You know what else I noticed in Jedi?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: There's more?

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: So they build another Death Star, right?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Now the first one they built was completed and fully operational before the Rebels destroyed it.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Luke blew it up. Give credit where it's due.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: And the second one was still being built when they blew it up.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Compliments of Lando Calrissian.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Something just never sat right with me the second time they destroyed it. I could never put my finger on it-something just wasn't right.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: And you figured it out?

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Well, the thing is, the first Death Star was manned by the Imperial army- storm troopers, dignitaries-the only people onboard were Imperials.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Basically.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: So when they blew it up, no prob. Evil is punished.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: And the second time around...?

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: The second time around, it wasn't even finished yet. They were still under construction.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: A construction job of that magnitude would require a helluva lot more manpower than the Imperial army had to offer. I'll bet there were independent contractors working on that thing: plumbers, aluminum siders, roofers.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Not just Imperials, is what you're getting at.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Exactly. In order to get it built quickly and quietly they'd hire anybody who could do the job. Do you think the average storm trooper knows how to install a toilet main?  All they know is killing and white uniforms.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: All right, so even if independent contractors are working on the Death Star, why are you uneasy with its destruction?

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: All those innocent contractors hired to do a job were killed- casualties of a war they had nothing to do with.  All right, look-you're a roofer, and some juicy government contract comes your way; you got the wife and kids and the two-story in suburbia-this is a government contract, which means all sorts of benefits. All of a sudden these left-wing militants blast you with lasers and wipe out everyone within a three-mile radius.  You didn't ask for that. You have no personal politics. You're just trying to scrape out a living.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: You'll never believe what this unruly customer just said...

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Wait.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: She's in here?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: This guy is going through all of the eggs. Look.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: What's he looking for?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: He said he has to find a perfect dozen.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Perfect dozen.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Each egg has to be perfect.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: The quest isn't going well?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Obviously not. Look at all the cartons that didn't make the grade.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Why doesn't he just mix and match?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I told him that and he yelled at me.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: What did he say?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: He said it was important to have standards. He said nobody has pride anymore.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: It's not like you laid the eggs yourself.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I'll give him five more minutes then I'm calling the cops. I don't need this, man. I'm not even supposed to be here today.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Did you ever notice all the prices end in nine? Damn, that's eerie.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: You know how much money the average jizz-mopper make per hour?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: What's a jizz-mopper?

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: He's the guy in those nudie-booth joints who cleans up after each guy that jerks off.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Nudie booth?

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Nudie booth. You've never been in a nudie booth?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I guess not.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Oh, it's great. You step into this little booth and there's this window between you and this naked woman, and she puts on this little show for like ten bucks.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: What kind of show?

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Think of the weirdest, craziest shit you'd like to see chicks do.  These chicks do it all. They insert things into any opening in their body... any opening.  He's led a very sheltered life.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Can we talk about this later?

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: The jizz-mopper's job is to clean up the booths afterward, because practically everybody shoots a load against the window, and I don't know if you know or not, but cum leaves streaks if you don't clean it right away.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Why do you do things like that? You know she's going to come back and tell the boss.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Who cares? That lady's an asshole. Everybody that comes in here is way too uptight. This job would be great if it wasn't for the fucking customers.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I'm gonna hear it tomorrow.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: You gotta loosen up, my friend. You'd feel a hell of a lot better if you'd rip into the occasional customer.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: What for? They don't bother me if I don't bother them.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Liar! Tell me there aren't customers that annoy the piss out of you on a daily basis.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: There aren't.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: How can you lie like that? Why don't you vent? Vent your frustration. Come on, who pisses you off?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: It's not really anyone per se, it's more of separate groupings.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Let's hear it.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: The milkmaids.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: The milkmaids?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: The women that go through every gallon of milk looking for a later date. As if somewhere-beyond all the other gallons-is a container of milk that won't go bad for like a decade.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: You know who I can do without? I could do without the people in the video store.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Which ones?

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: All of them.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Because my ex-girlfriend is getting married.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Jesus, you got a one-track mind. It's always Caitlin, Caitlin, Caitlin...

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Veronica!

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Thirty-seven!

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Shut up!  Yes, I've calmed down, I'm still not happy about it, but I've been able to deal.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Can you come next door? I gotta make a phone call.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Smokey Three: thumbs up, am I right?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: The best Burtless movie ever made.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Vermont?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Can you believe this?!

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: He didn't mention it when he called you this morning?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Not a fucking word! Slippery shit!

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: So, what-you're stuck here all day?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: FUCK!

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Why'd you apologize?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: I heard you apologize. Why? You have every right in the world to be mad.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: That seems to be the leitmotif in your life; ever backing down.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I don't back down.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Yes, you do. You always back down. You assume blame that isn't yours, you come in when called as opposed to enjoying your day off, you buckle like a belt.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: You know what pisses me off the most?

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: The fact that I'm right about your buckling?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I'm going to miss the game.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Because you buckled.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Would you shut the hell up with that shit? It's not helping.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Don't yell at me, pal.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: See? There you go again.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I can't believe I'm going to miss the game!

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: At least we're stuck here together.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: You've got a customer.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Pull my laces tighter.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: I've gotta tell you, my friend: this is one of the ballsiest moves I've ever been privy to. I never would have thought you capable of such blatant disregard of store policy.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I told him I had a game today. It's his own fault.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: No argument here. Insubordination rules.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I just want to play hockey like I was scheduled to.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: He's blunt, but he's got a point.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: At least let me maintain some semblance of managerial control here.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Design major.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Can we not talk about this?

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Are you gonna lock the store?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I don't know. You going to lock the video store?

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Look who you're asking here. How're we gonna block off the street?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: We're not playing in the street.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Then where're we gonna play?

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Helluva game!

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: One ball!! They come all the way here... I close the damn store... for one ball!

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Hockey's hockey. At least we got to play.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Randal, twelve minutes is not a game! Jesus, it's barely a warm-up!

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Bitch, bitch, bitch. You want something to drink?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Gatorade.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: What happened to all the Gatorade?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Exactly. They drank it all.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: After an exhausting game like that I can believe it.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: "It's not like we're gonna sell out."

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: You know what Sanford told me?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I still can't believe Caitlin's getting married.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Julie Dwyer died.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Yeah, right.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: No, I'm serious.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Oh, my god.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Sanford's brother dates her cousin. He found out this morning.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: How? When?

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Embolism in her brain. Yesterday.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Jesus.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: She was swimming at the YMCA pool when it happened. Died mid-backstroke.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I haven't seen her in almost two years.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Correct me if I'm wrong, but wasn't she one of the illustrious twelve?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Number six.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: You've had sex with a dead person.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I'm gonna go to her wake.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: No, you're not.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: It's today.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: What!?

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Paulsen's Funeral Parlor. The next show is at four.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Shit. What about tomorrow?

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: One night only. She's buried in the morning.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: You've gotta watch the store. I have to go to this.

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: Wait, wait, wait. Has it occurred to you that I might bereaved as well?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: You hardly knew her!

turns.speaker: RANDAL
turns.text: True, but do you know how many people are going to be there? All of our old classmates, to say the least.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Stop it. This is beneath even you.

turns.text: How many dicks have you sucked?!

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Let it go...

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: HOW MANY?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: All right! Shut up a second and I'll tell you! Jesus! I didn't freak like this when you told me how many girls you fucked.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: This is different. This is important. How many?!

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Well...?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Something like thirty-six.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: WHAT? SOMETHING LIKE THIRTY-SIX?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Lower your voice!

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: What the hell is that anyway, "something like thirty-six?" Does that include me?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Um. Thirty-seven.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I'M THIRTY-SEVEN?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: I'm going to class.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Thirty-seven?!  My girlfriend sucked thirty-seven dicks!

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Hey! Where are you going?!

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Hey listen, jerk! Until today you never even knew how many guys I'd slept with, because you never even asked. And then you act all nonchalant about fucking twelve different girls. Well, I never had sex with twelve different guys!

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: No, but you sucked enough dick!

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Yeah, I went down on a few guys...

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: A few?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: ...And one of those guys was you! The last one, I might add, which-if you're too stupid to comprehend- means that I've been faithful to you since we met! All the other guys I went with before I met you, so, if you want to have a complex about it, go ahead!  But don't look at me like I'm the town whore, because you were plenty busy yourself, before you met me!

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Well... why did you have to suck their dicks? Why didn't you just sleep with them, like any decent person?!

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Because going down it's a big deal! I used to like a guy, we'd make out, and sooner or later I'd go down on him. But I only had sex with the guys I loved.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I feel sick.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: I love you. Don't feel sick.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Every time I kiss you now I'm going to taste thirty-six other guys.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: I'm going to school. Maybe later you'll be a bit more rational.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Thirty-seven. I just can't...

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Goodbye, Dante.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: He still hasn't shown up. Why aren't you in class?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Lit 101 got canceled, so I stopped home and brought you some lunch.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Peanut butter and jelly with the crusts cut off. What do you think it is? It's lasagne.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Really?  You're the best.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: I'm glad you've calmed down a bit.  Hi, Randal.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: You had to tell him.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I had to tell someone. He put it into perspective.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: What did he say?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: At least he wasn't thirty-six.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: And that made you feel better?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: And he said most of them are college guys, I've never met or seen.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: The ostrich syndrome: if you don't see it...

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: ...it isn't there. Yes.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Thank you for being rational.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Thank you for the lasagne.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: You couldn't get these shutters open?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I called a locksmith and he said the earliest he could get here it tomorrow.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Bummer, Well, I've gotta head back for the one-thirty class.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: What time do you get finished?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Eight. But I have a sorority meeting till nine, so I'll be back before you close. Can we go out and get some coffee?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Good.  I'll see you when you close, then. Enjoy the lasagne.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: What the fuck did you do that for?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: If you didn't want to go out with me anymore, why didn't you just say it? Instead, you pussyfoot around and see that slut behind my back!

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: What're you talking about?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: You've been talking to her on the phone for weeks!

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: It was only a few times...

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: And then you pull that shit this morning, freaking out because I've gone down on a couple guys!

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: A couple...?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: I'm not the one trying to patch things up with my ex, sneaking around behind your back! And if you think that thirty-seven dicks are a lot, then just wait, mister: I'm going to put the hookers in Times Square to shame with all the guys I go down on now!

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Would you let me explain...

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Explain what? How you were waiting until the time was right, and then you were going to dump me for her?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Veronica... I... it's not like that anymore... I mean, it was never really like that...

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: You're damn right it's not like that! Because I won't let it be like that! You want your slut? Fine!  The slut is yours!

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I don't want Caitlin...

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: You don't know what you want, but I'm not going to sit here anymore holding your hand until you figure it out! I've encouraged you to get out of this fucking dump and go back to school, to take charge of your life and find direction. I even transferred so maybe you would be more inclined to go back to college if I was with you. Everyone said it was a stupid move, but I didn't care because I loved you and wanted to see you pull yourself out of this senseless funk you've been in since that whore dumped you, oh so many years ago. And now you want to go back to her so she can fuck you over some more?

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I don't want to go back with her...

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Of course not; not now! You're caught, and now you're trying to snake out of doing what you wanted to do. Well, I won't let you. I want you to follow through on this, just so you can find out what a fucking idiot you are. And when she dumps you again- and she will, Dante, I promise you that-when she dumps you again, I want to laugh at you, right in your face, just so you realize that that was what you gave up our relationship for!  I'm just glad Randal had the balls to tell me, since you couldn't.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Randal...?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: And having him tell me... that was just the weakest move ever. You're spineless.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Veronica, I love you...

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Fuck you.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: You hold the counter and I'll pull.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Usually I just turn the can upside down.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: Maybe we should soap your hand or something.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: They oughta put some kind of warning on these cans, like they do with cigarettes.

turns.speaker: DANTE
turns.text: I think it's coming now...
